title: Vitamin D and immune cells stimulate bone marrow disease

title_detail.value: Vitamin D and immune cells stimulate bone marrow disease

summary: The bone marrow disease myelofibrosis is stimulated by excessive signaling from vitamin D and immune cells known as macrophages, reveals a research team. These findings could help to develop alternative treatments that do not target problem genes.

summary_detail.value: The bone marrow disease myelofibrosis is stimulated by excessive signaling from vitamin D and immune cells known as macrophages, reveals a research team. These findings could help to develop alternative treatments that do not target problem genes.
